TopicTitle: Please help me find the Rosetta images

Articles.Content:
Today ESA anouced that all pictures Rosetta made of the comet (with its navigation camera) will be distributed under a open licence (Source, in german: Heise.de). Sadly im not able to find all those images. There are some in my source, but i assume they are not the highest resolution possible, also that are not all pictures.

When i look at e.g. http://www.esa.int/spaceinimages/Images/2014/11 it should show all ESA pitures made this month but there are none made of the comet. Where are all those (propably thousands) of pictures in original quality?

ESA says:

For the time being , we will just update the ESA Rosetta NAVCAM images where they already exist: That is essentially

- ESA Portal http://spaceinimages.esa.int/

- ESA Flickr https://www.flickr.com/photos/europeanspaceagency

- This blog.

We might however set up a separate collection of CC-licenced images sometime in the future, tbd ...

Source

Edited November 5, 2014 by Dkmdlb
